title: Cognitive Load Theory-Based Remote Interactive Multimedia Learning Design

context.prior_knowledge: Fundamental digital literacy and intermediate expertise in social sciences
context.additional_context: Goal-oriented design of effective online learning environments for social sector professionals in smartphone-centric limited-technology settings

learning_goals: Learners can design multimedia content for remote education by applying cognitive load theory
Learners can effectively utilize interactive learning materials (quizzes, simulations, etc.) in smartphone-based environments
Learners can apply chunking and segmentation strategies by analyzing the complexity of learning content

constraints.tech_requirements: Limited tech environment (no PC, smartphone only)

difficulty: Hard - Complex requirements with multiple constraints
